com.hush.pgp
Class Signable

java.lang.Object
  com.hush.pgp.Signable
All Implemented Interfaces:
PgpConstants, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Key, Signature, UserAttribute, UserID
public abstract class Signable
extends java.lang.Object
implements PgpConstants, java.io.Serializable

An abstract class to group objects that have signatures associated with them.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Signable

public Signable()
Method Detail

addSignature

public final void addSignature(Signature signature)
Adds a signature to the signable entity.

Parameters:
signature - the signature to add

getBytesForSignature

public abstract byte[] getBytesForSignature(int signatureVersion)

getSignatures

public final Signature[] getSignatures(int type,
                                       byte[] signerKeyID)
Returns all the signatures on this object of the specified type created by a key with the specified key ID. Note that these signatures may not yet have been verified. Passing -1 as the type will return signatures of all types. Passing null as the key ID will return signatures for all key IDs.

Parameters:
type - the type of signature to return
signerKeyID - identifies the key that created the signature; null for all
Returns:
an array of signatures

getMainKey

public final Key getMainKey()
Gets the parent key of this object. In the case of a subkey or user ID, this is the main key.

Returns:
the main key associated with this object

verifySignatures

public final Signature[] verifySignatures(Key signer,
                                          int[] signatureTypes,
                                          long time,
                                          boolean dieOnFailure)
                                   throws InvalidSignatureException
This method returns all the signatures by the signer on this object that can be verified.

Parameters:
signer - the signer
signatureTypes - verify signatures of these types; null for all
dieOnFailure - if true, an exception will be thrown on a verification failure
Returns:
the verified signatures
Throws:
PgpException - if a signature fails to verify and dieOnFailure is true
InvalidSignatureException

sign

public void sign(Signature signature,
                 Key signer,
                 int signatureType,
                 long creationTime,
                 java.security.SecureRandom random)
          throws UnrecoverableKeyException
Computes the signature and adds it to the signatures on this object. Set any flags on the signature you want before computing it.

Parameters:
signature - the signture to be added
signer - the private key with which to create the signature
signatureType - the type of signature to generate
creationTime - the creation time in seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 GMT
Throws:
PgpException - if the secret key cannot be accessed
UnrecoverableKeyException

removeSignature

public void removeSignature(Signature signature)
Removes the specified signature from the object.

Parameters:
signature - the signature to remove

getRevocationSignatures

public Signature[] getRevocationSignatures(byte[] signerKeyID)
Returns any revocation signatures found on the object or its main key. It does not verify the signatures.

Parameters:
signerKeyID - return only signatures by this signer

isRevoked

public boolean isRevoked()
Checks to see if there are any revocation signatures on either this object or it's main key. It does not verify the signatures.
